page.title: 04BUNNY'S OLDEST RESIDENT
page.content: Mrs.Ida Oliver lives in Ivy Cottage on Main Street. Her house is 350 years old. There are five very old houses in the village and these houses had the first telephones and electricity. They also had water from Bunny Hill piped through lead pipes into back yard tanks. Everyone collected rain water in tubs. This was used on Mondays for washing. Mrs. Oliver still has a wash house with a fireplace in it. After mains water was brought in Mr. Oliver still used rain water to shave. Mrs. Oliver can remember when the Fairham Brook flooded so deep it went up to the horses' tummies outside the shop. Sometimes the brook was blocked on purpose near the bridge, and used for sheep dipping. Once a year it was cleaned out. Mrs. Oliver is the oldest resident in Bunny, being in her 90's. and she has lived here for 50 years.
